caption:
This large-scale rope sculpture draws viewers in with its intricate yet minimal design. Light streams in through the central negative space and the webbing extending towards the edges of the external cube.
This work was built by Marceline and a small team of assistants. It was displayed at Tethered Together 2019, where Marceline was invited as an artist and educator.
Modeling by Anya Demure, Rope and Photo by Marceline VQ

title: Taking up space
caption: Marcelineâ€™s work engages with the dimensionality of space. The rope acts as a one-dimensional object embedded in a 3D world, and when tied together into a structure, becomes something new entirely. The camera, too, imposes its own dimensional constraints, projecting a 3D object onto 2D space. The interplay of each of these elements is a central theme in the Portal series.

Tethered Together is a New England-based event focused on rope bondage with additional programming in circus arts, kink, relationships, and body movement such as dance and yoga. Along with educational workshops, we host an assortment of quirky, magical, and fun attendee-led programming, art installations, and entertainment.
